subject: Preakness Stakes
Rachel Alexandra (Race Horse)
Television
lead_paragraph: Rachel Alexandra’s victory over Mine that Bird on Saturday in the Preakness Stakes was seen by an average of 10.9 million viewers on NBC, the most since 11.6 million watched Smarty Jones win in 2004 and the second most for the second leg of the Triple Crown in 20 years. The viewership covers the period that the network calls “the race portion,” from 5:56 to 6:50 p.m. Eastern, although NBC’s Preakness programming began at 4:30.
